discover.instruction: Read about life experiences. Notice how the same verb can have different meanings.
discover.instruction_ru: Прочитай о жизненном опыте. Обрати внимание, как один и тот же глагол может иметь разные значения.

content.text: I <highlight>remember meeting</highlight> her for the first time - it was magical. I <highlight>remembered to call</highlight> her yesterday, as I promised. I <highlight>stopped smoking</highlight> last year - best decision ever! I had to <highlight>stop to smoke</highlight> during the long drive. I'll <highlight>never forget seeing</highlight> the Northern Lights. Please don't <highlight>forget to lock</highlight> the door. I <highlight>tried pressing</highlight> the button but nothing happened. I <highlight>tried to press</highlight> it harder, but it was stuck. I <highlight>regret telling</highlight> her the truth. I <highlight>regret to tell</highlight> you that you've failed.
content.question: How does the meaning change between gerund and infinitive?
content.question_ru: Как меняется значение между герундием и инфинитивом?

theory.title: Verbs with Different Meanings: Gerund vs Infinitive
theory.title_ru: Глаголы с разными значениями: Герундий vs Инфинитив

points.rule: remember + -ing = recall a past action; remember + to = not forget to do
points.rule_ru: remember + -ing = вспомнить прошлое действие; remember + to = не забыть сделать
points.example: I remember locking the door. (I recall doing it) vs Remember to lock the door. (Don't forget)

points.rule: forget + -ing = not recall a past action; forget + to = fail to do something
points.rule_ru: forget + -ing = не помнить прошлое; forget + to = не сделать что-то
points.example: I'll never forget meeting him. vs I forgot to meet him. (I didn't meet him)

points.rule: stop + -ing = quit doing; stop + to = pause in order to do
points.rule_ru: stop + -ing = прекратить делать; stop + to = остановиться, чтобы сделать
points.example: Stop talking! (quit) vs I stopped to talk. (paused in order to talk)

points.rule: try + -ing = experiment; try + to = attempt (with effort)
points.rule_ru: try + -ing = попробовать как эксперимент; try + to = пытаться (с усилием)
points.example: Try adding salt. (experiment) vs Try to add salt. (attempt, it's difficult)

points.rule: regret + -ing = feel sorry about past; regret + to = formal announcement of bad news
points.rule_ru: regret + -ing = сожалеть о прошлом; regret + to = формальное сообщение плохой новости
points.example: I regret saying that. vs I regret to say you failed. (formal)

comparison_table.infinitive: forget to do = fail to do
stop to do = pause to do
regret to do = announce bad news
go on to do = move to next

tasks.text:
A day in my life:

1. I woke up and remembered to take my medication.
2. I remember being so healthy as a child.
3. On my way to work, I stopped to buy coffee.
4. I've stopped drinking so much caffeine.
5. I tried opening the window, but it was painted shut.
6. I tried to open it with more force but failed.
7. I regret not studying harder in my youth.
8. I regret to inform you that your application was rejected.
9. After finishing the report, I went on to check my emails.
10. I went on working until midnight.

exercises.instruction: Find and correct the mistake based on the context.

sentences.incorrect: I stopped to smoke last year. (quit the habit)
I remember to meet him at the party. (recall past)
sentences.correct: I remember meeting him at the party.

sentences.incorrect: I regret saying that you failed. (formal announcement)
sentences.correct: I regret to say that you failed.
sentences.explanation: Formal bad news = regret + to infinitive

produce.instruction: Write about memories, regrets, and things you've tried, showing the meaning differences.
produce.instruction_ru: Напиши о воспоминаниях, сожалениях и вещах, которые ты пробовал, показывая различия в значениях.
prompts: Write about things you remember doing and things you remembered to do
Describe habits you've stopped and times you stopped to do something
Write about experiments (try + -ing) and attempts (try + to)
Share regrets about the past and formal announcements
produce.example: Looking back on my life, I have many memories. I remember playing in my grandmother's garden as a child - those were happy times. I always remembered to call her on her birthday; I never forgot. Last year, I stopped eating junk food - one of my best decisions. Sometimes during work, I stop to eat a healthy snack. When my old computer was slow, I tried reinstalling the software - it worked! I had tried to fix it many times before without success. I regret not spending more time with my grandparents. As their doctor, I regret to inform you that her condition has worsened. After finishing school, she went on to become a successful lawyer.
criteria: Uses try/-ing for experiments vs try + to for attempts

texts.title: Life Changes
texts.content: I remember being young and carefree. I always remembered to do my homework though! Last year, I stopped procrastinating - it changed my life. Sometimes I stop to reflect on how far I've come. I tried meditating and it really helped. I had tried to meditate before but couldn't focus. I regret not starting sooner. I don't regret to say that change is possible for everyone!

texts.title: Career Journey
texts.content: I remember starting my first job nervously. I always remembered to arrive early - punctuality matters. After ten years, I stopped working there. I stopped to consider my options carefully. I tried freelancing as an experiment - I loved it! I tried to convince my family it was a good idea. I regret not taking risks earlier. I regret to inform you I'm leaving, but I must follow my dreams.

texts.title: Health Journey
texts.content: I remember being overweight and unhappy. I never forgot to take my medication. Eventually, I stopped eating fast food. During workouts, I'd stop to catch my breath. I tried different diets to see what worked. I tried to exercise every day but it was hard. I regret ignoring my health for so long. My doctor regrets to inform me that my cholesterol was dangerously high.

texts.title: Learning Languages
texts.content: I remember struggling with French pronunciation. I always remembered to practice daily. After six months, I stopped translating in my head. I'd stop to chat with native speakers. I tried watching films without subtitles - very helpful! I tried to understand every word but that was impossible. I regret not learning languages as a child. She regrets to say that the advanced class is full.

texts.title: Relationship Story
texts.content: I remember meeting my partner clearly. I always remembered to text good morning. After arguments, we'd stop fighting and talk. Sometimes we'd stop to appreciate small moments. I tried being more patient - it worked wonders. I tried to change some habits but old patterns are hard. I regret saying hurtful things in the past. Now I never regret to say 'I love you' every day.

grammar_cards.back:
remember doing = recall past action
remember to do = don't forget to do

stop doing = quit
stop to do = pause in order to

try doing = experiment
try to do = attempt with effort

regret doing = sorry about past
regret to do = formal bad news

common_errors: Not recognizing regret + to as formal
